data.title: parkhill-racquetclub
data.text:
The Book Club was started in 2008 and is still going strong! The friendly group meets every 5-6 weeks in our lower lounge to discuss the book chosen by one of us.

​

We have read fiction, non-fiction, memoirs, short stories and is there anything else? Discussions are always enjoyable accompanied by snacks and drinks for those interested. It is open to all, even if you'd only like to join for select books. We also have semi-regular poetry readings and movie screenings which coincide with our book selections.

​

Book Club meetings always provide a fine evening of wine, snacks and some lively - but friendly - conversation. All Racquet Club members are invited to join us at any time!

​

Contact Claire Miko at parkhillracquetclub@gmail.com, if you would like to be included.

Books We’ve Read:

The Secret History by Donna Tartt

The Story of Edgar Sawtelle by David Wroblewski

A Prayer for Owen Meany by John Irving

Flannery O’Connor’s novella, Wise Blood

The Bridge of San Luis Rey by Thornton Wilder

Bel Canto by Ann Patchett

100 Years of Solitude by Gabriel Garcia Marquez

The Man from St. Petersburg by Ken Follett

The Things They Carried by Tim O’Brien

The Glass Castle, a memoir by Jeannette Walls

As I Lay Dying by William Faulkner

Jitterbug Perfume by Tom Robbins

Farewell My Lovely, the detective classic by Raymond Chandler

Mr. Peanut by Adam Ross

The Good Earth by Pearl S. Buck

The Elegance of the Hedgehog, by French novelist, Muriel Barbery

The Memory of Running by Ron McLarty

Hotel on the Corner of Bitter and Sweet by Jamie Ford

Those Who Save Us by Jenna Blum

Sons and Lovers by D. H. Lawrence

A Passage to India by E.M. Forster

The Help by Kathryn Stockett

Lamb by Christopher Moore

Let the Great World Spin by Colm McAnn

The Water is Wide by Pat Conroy

Nightwoods by Charles Frazier

To the End of the Land by David Grossman

The Whistling Season by Ivan DoigAn Imaginary Life by David Malouf

A Visit from the Goon Squad, short stories by Jennifer Egan

The Master and Margarita, a Russian classic by Mikhail Bulgakov

Year of Wonders: A Novel of the Plague by Geraldine Brooks

The Septembers of Shiraz by Dalia Sofer

Awake in the Dark by Shira Nayman

The Mayor of Casterbridge by Thomas Hardy

Canada by Richard Ford

Final Payments by Mary Gordon

Cutting for Stone by Abraham Verghese

The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald

Hateship, Friendship, Courtship, Loveship, Marriage by Alice Munro

Inherent Vice by Thomas Pynchon

The Liars' Club by Mary Karr

Lean In by Sheryl Sandberg

The Tortilla Curtain by T.C. Boyle

Middlesex by Jeffrey Eugenides

This is Where I Leave You by Jonathan Tropper

Fever, an historical novel about "Typhoid Mary" by Mary Beth Keane

The Word Exchange by Alena Graedon

Giovanni's Room by James Baldwin

The Goldfinch by Donna Tartt

All the Light We Cannot See by Anthony Doerr

H is for Hawk by Helen McDonald

The Crucible, a play by Arthur Miller

To the End of the Land by David Grossman
